text_blocks.content: Case 1:19-cr-00830-AT Document 26 Filed 02/10/20 Page 13 of 15 13
k1u2NoeC kjc

1 problem zealously representing my client, and I will do so. If my daughter is going to be in Italy, ironically, and my wife and my other daughter are going to travel there at the end of her program so we can spend time, how is that an issue for us to take that into consideration in a professional setting? Like, I don't understand.
THE COURT: Counsel, you will use Skype. Is there anything --
MR. FOY: No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.
THE COURT: Is there anything further?
MR. FOY: I'm not going to use --
THE COURT: Counsel, I have heard enough. Is there anything further?
MR. FOY: Well, look, I'm not --
THE COURT: Sit down, counsel.
MR. FOY: Can I be heard?
THE COURT: You will sit down.
MR. FOY: And then be heard from the seat?
THE COURT: No. You will sit down.
Is there anything further unrelated to the vacation plans --
MR. FOY: This is not just vacation, your Honor.
THE COURT: Counsel, I have had it. Now, you sit down and stop --
MR. FOY: Before --
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a conversation between MR. FOY and THE COURT. The conversation is about a personal matter and the use of Skype. The tone is confrontational.
